StudyInfo.StudyNameEntrez: Inflammatory Bowel Disease Immunochip from NIDDK repository

Person.Organization: ICAHN SCHOOL OF MEDICINE AT MOUNT SINAIUNIVERSITY OF CHICAGOYALE UNIVERSITY

Policy.acknowledgement_statement: Recruitment of study participants, phenotyping and Immunochip genotyping was conducted by the NIDDK IBD Genetics Consortium (IBDGC). IBDGC investigators include: Dr. Steven R. Brant (Johns Hopkins University), Dr. Judy H. Cho (Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai), Dr. Richard H. Duerr (University of Pittsburgh), Dr. Dermot B. P. McGovern (Cedars-Sinai Medical Center), Dr. John D. Rioux (Montréal-Boston Collaborative IBD Genetic Research Center) and Dr. Mark S. Silverberg (University of Toronto, Samuel Lunenfeld Research Institute, Mount Sinai Hospital). The IBDGC is supported by the National Institute of Diabetes and Digestive and Kidney Diseases (NIDDK). The data reported here were supplied by the IBDGC’s Data Coordinating Center. This manuscript was not prepared in collaboration with the IBDGC and does not necessarily reflect the opinions or views of the IBDGC investigators or the NIDDK.

ConsentGroup.title: Health/Medical/Biomedical (IRB, NPU, MDS)
ConsentGroup.name: HMB-IRB-NPU-MDS
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of this data is limited to health/medical/biomedical purposes, does not include the study of population origins or ancestry. Requestor must provide documentation of local IRB approval. Use of the data is limited to not-for-profit organizations. Use of the data includes methods development research (e.g., development of software or algorithms).
